author: A_Brickset_user
title: Neat display object
review: I wouldn't really reccomend it as a toy, but it makes a neat desk display item if you are into street racers. Most of the decals are pre-painted on the pieces, very few stickers. Some of the pieces are new so that adds points. Inexpenisve addition to a Lego collection.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Awesome little race car!
review: The new pieces in this set are awesome. I like how the can can become a garage for it, too. The "Tiny Turbos" are very neat additions to any Lego collection. The Racers sets are getting better and Lego is making more Tiny Turbos later in the year, they are still prototypes though.

author: bmwlego
title: Great Parts, Cool Look, Too Many Stickers and Printed Parts However
review:
Street Maniac is a nice little Racers car. It looks beautiful, on par with the Flame Glider until you put on the stickers. There are too many stickers and when coupled with the printed mudguard parts, the car loses all LEGO-ness. It begins to look like a Hot Wheels car. Is this what LEGO wanted, to look like another children's toy and lose what makes their products distinctively LEGO? I built this set with out stickers and labeled parts and it looks stunning. The wheels are great and they are my favorite Racers wheels. The wedge plate to make up the windshield is a great part as well. The plate with Racer grill that makes up the middle front of the car is a great part. I used it to add a nice touch to a Tiny Turbos inspired Go-Kart MOC that is pictured on my Brickshelf Gallery. Copy and paste this link in your web browser to check it out:
http://www.brickshelf.com/cgi-bin/gallery.cgi?m=notenoughbricks

author: Shadow_Crawler
title: MANIAC!
review:
Very bright colour flanked with fire decorations, this set is extremely good-looking.

Pros:
Nice colour
Good fire decorations
Good curve car style

Cons:
Stickers
Bad backside design

Regards,
Shadow Crawler

author: Gus_263
title: Street Maniac
review: This is a set from the tiny turbos subtheme. Like the other sets from the same subtheme, this is good altough without any pilot minifigure or a place to put one, because this isn't the idea of the set. This is a good packaged set, and have 36 useful pieces. Some have stickers and printed details. If you think that they aren't good, these can be replaced or don't be used. But, this isn't a great con, and this still deserving a good rate. The yellow color makes a good scheme with those stickers, and have good shapes to keep a well made design on this set. Like the parts above the wheels, where are details of the flashlights of the car. A black piece to looks like with the glass of the car is placed low, but still cool. The back spoiler is good to the design, and the wheels too, under the parts of the flashlights, but well made to runs well. This set is useful in any of the 36 pieces, to make combination models or bigger ones where can be putted a minifigure. Altough small, is in a good size for races with many cars, and is easy make tricks with this don't dismantling. For many things, this tiny turbo deserves a 5/5 rate.

author: CharlieTheFunEngine
title: TinyTurbosCityAndToyStory Reviews Episode 15: Street Maniac
review:
One of my favourite Tiny Turbos, but not the best.

Building Experience:

All Tiny Turbos are great in this area due to the volume of little parts that build them up.

Parts:

Nothing really stands out as being unique or rare. I've never seen printed decals on the wheel arch parts in any other set.

Playability:

VA-ROOM! Race Street Maniac against your other Tiny Turbos. Race away from the police (8665). If you break down, call Ed's Tow Truck Service (8195) to get you back on the streets.

Value for Money:

Tiny Turbos are the perfect "Pocket Money Set" for young LEGO fans, and their economical price keeps the strain off my budget, too.

Overall:

Tiny Turbos are a streak of LEGO genius and deserve genuine praise.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Racers (Tiny Turbos) - Street Maniac Review
review:
If you ask me this is my favourite LEGO Racers (Tiny Turbos) set I have. It's an easy build and I also love the design of this small vehicle. We also get a few stickers which you need to put on and you also get a few printed pieces. The car can be maneuvered very easily and I also like the colors on it. It's a fun set to have for sure.

All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
